New Records: Nikola Jokic and Russell Westbrook became the first pair of teammates to record a triple-double in the same game twice in a single season.
Nikola Jokic recorded his NBA-leading 15th triple-double of the season.
Nikola Jokic and Russell Westbrook are the first to record a 25-point triple-double in the same regular-season game.
Russell Westbrook recorded his 202nd career triple-double, which is the NBA record.
Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic finished with 35 points, 15 assists, and 12 rebounds.
Russell Westbrook had 25 points, 11 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Jokic returned to the game in the fourth quarter and had 9 points, 4 assists, and 3 rebounds.
Westbrook had four assists in the fourth quarter to record his triple-double.
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Jokic emphasized the importance of winning games over individual stats.
Russell Westbrook credited coach Michael Malone for giving him the freedom to play his game.
Westbrook expressed his desire to bring leadership, energy, and toughness to the team.
